comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: That a cutie. And those were the de rigeur shoes for kids of that era. I had them too!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/la_belle_province] Were they usually kind of reddish-brown?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: Yes, they were chestnut for everyday. The ones for church or visiting were shiny patent leather or velvet. But we called all of them "buckle shoes".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/la_belle_province] Excellent! Buckle shoes now added as a tag...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
Excellent shot - the little boy make the picture!
I remember the bric-a-brac and bookshop along there from the mid-1970's. If I had time after school I would wander down as far as South of the river.
Stuart.

comment.author: 54708393@N08
comment._content: That happy little lad looks like he's carrying home some prized toy from Hector Grays just over the bridge!.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54708393@N08] Paddle? Gun?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/23885771@N03] You wild thing, you! From where did you wander?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] Looking back, growing up in the 60's and 70's we children had so much more freedom than children nowadays. Much less danger from traffic too. 

I went to O'Connell Schools on the North Circular Road and often went into town to catch the bus home because the terminus was the only place I could be sure of getting on the bus - otherwise the busses were full after they left the terminus! A favourite haunt of mine for a good browse was Woolworths in Henry Street - they always seemed to have such good looking girls working there.

Stuart.

comment._content: Fantastic photo.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/42400804@N05] To lessen the bounce?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 92169882@N07
comment._content: It was a gun do you know if I can get a copy of this picture from the national library. I have a personal interest in the picture, I am the little boy in it

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92169882@N07] Well, hello there! Lovely to hear from you, and to know it was a gun you were running along with... If there's any other information you'd like to add, we'd REALLY love to hear it! We've managed to add names to this other Elinor Wiltshire photo also taken in 1969, so it'd be lovely to have yours, or to know how old you were, etc. You can, of course, get a copy. If you get on to our Reprographics Department, they'd be delighted to help. You can get either a print or a digital copy. Email copy-orders@nli.ie and give them the name of the photo from our catalogue: Man sitting outside furniture shop, Merchant's Arch, Temple Bar, Dublin and the NLI call no. WIL 57[9]. It's from our Wiltshire Collection.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 42400804@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92169882@N07] how amazing that you have found this picture of yourself - is it your father behind you?

comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: Wow! The Internet at its finest.

comment.author: 92169882@N07
comment._content: Cheers my name is colm Irwin and I was about 3 . It was strange how I came across the image it was in the evening had just looked at sky news and for some unknown reason googled images of old Dublin and there was this image a bit surreal seeing yourself in the picture. Haven't really changed a good bit taller and I still have my own teeth ... Cheers

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92169882@N07] Fantastic! Thanks for coming back to us, Colm. I've added your info up above under the photo.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92169882@N07] And this just in, Colm! TheJournal.ie featured you in your fine shorts and sandals ensemble today. P.S. Could you let me know by Flickr Mail whether you'd like a print of the photo or a digital image, and where to send it - free of charge obviously - think that's only fair...
